package.name: rsync
package.description:
rsync is a replacement for rcp that has many more features.
rsync uses the "rsync algorithm" which provides a very fast method for bringing remote files into sync. It does this by sending just the differences in the files across the link, without requiring that both sets of files are present at one of the ends of the link beforehand. At first glance this may seem impossible because the calculation of diffs between two files normally requires local access to both files.

package.name: rsync
package.description:
rsync is a replacement for rcp that has many more features.
rsync uses the "rsync algorithm" which provides a very fast method for bringing remote files into sync. It does this by sending just the differences in the files across the link, without requiring that both sets of files are present at one of the ends of the link beforehand. At first glance this may seem impossible because the calculation of diffs between two files normally requires local access to both files.

package.name: textutils
package.description:
The GNU Text Utilities are the basic text-manipulation utilities.
The tools supplied with this package are: * cat - concatenate files and print to the standard output * cksum - checksum and count the bytes in a file * comm - compare two sorted files line by line * csplit - split a file into sections determined by context lines * cut - remove sections from each line of files * expand - convert tabs to spaces * fmt - simple optimal text formatter * fold - wrap each input line to fit in specified width * join - join lines of two files on a common field * md5sum - compute and check MD5 message digest * nl - number lines of files * od - dump files in octal and other formats * paste - merge lines of files * pr - convert text files for printing * ptx - produce a permuted index of file contents * sort - sort lines of text files * split - split a file into pieces * sum - checksum and count the blocks in a file * tac - concatenate and print files in reverse * tail - output the last part of files * tr - translate or delete characters * tsort - perform topological sort * unexpand - convert spaces to tabs * uniq - remove duplicate lines from a sorted file * wc - print the number of bytes, words, and lines in files * head - output the first part of files

item.para: Update gettext dependency from 0.11.4 to 0.14.1

package.name: pkgutils
package.description: Package-manager independent suite of tools used to install, remove, and configure binary packages. Using an XML configuration file to describe the package, the pkgutils suite automatically downloads and installs packages including all necessary dependencies, provides information on the list of installed packages, removes packages, configures packages (runs the package pre-remove and post-install scripts), and queries a repository for a list of updated packages.

package.name: pkgutils
package.description: Package-manager independent suite of tools used to install, remove, and configure binary packages. Using an XML configuration file to describe the package, the pkgutils suite automatically downloads and installs packages including all necessary dependencies, provides information on the list of installed packages, removes packages, configures packages (runs the package pre-remove and post-install scripts), and queries a repository for a list of updated packages.

package.name: perl
package.description:
Perl is a general-purpose programming language originally developed for text manipulation and now used for a wide range of tasks including system administration, web development, network programming, GUI development, and more.
The language is intended to be practical (easy to use, efficient, complete) rather than beautiful (tiny, elegant, minimal). Its major features are that it's easy to use, supports both procedural and object-oriented (OO) programming, has powerful built-in support for text processing, and has one of the world's most impressive collections of third-party modules.

item.para: Added the following module: Net-SFTP 0.09
Updated the following modules: MIME-Tools from 5.415 to 5.417; MIME-Types from 1.12 to 1.15; Mail-Box from 2.059 to 2.061; MailTools from 1.58 to 1.67

Added the following modules: Class-ErrorHandler 0.01, Class-Loader 2.03, Convert-ASCII-Armour 1.4, Convert-PEM 0.07, Crypt-Blowfish 2.09, Crypt-CBC 2.14, Crypt-DES 2.03, Crypt-DES_EDE3 0.01, Crypt-DH 0.03, Crypt-DSA 0.12, Crypt-Primes 0.50, Crypt-Random 1.25, Crypt-RSA 1.55, Data-Buffer 0.04, DBD File-0.34, DBIx-ContextualFetch 1.02, Digest-BubbleBabble 0.01, Digest-MD2 2.03, HTML-FillInForm 1.05, Image-Info 1.16, Image-Size 2.992, Math-BigInt 1.77, Net-Daemon-SSL 1.0, Net-IP 1.23, Net-SSH-Perl 1.28, Schedule-Cron 0.9, Sort-Versions 1.5, String-CRC32 1.3, Tie-EncryptedHash 1.21, Time-modules 2003.1126, sdf 2.001
Removed Class-DBI-mysql, DBD-mysql, and Time-Piece-MySQL modules as they are now part of the MySQL package
Removed DBD-Pg module as it is now part of the PostgreSQL package

Updated the following modules: Graph from 0.20102 to 0.65; Graph-ReadWrite from 1.07 to 2.00; GraphViz from 1.8 to 2.02; Heap from 0.50 to 0.71; Net-DNS from 0.39 to 0.52; SQL-Statement from 1.004 to 1.14; Test-Pod from 0.95 to 1.20; XML-Writer from 0.4 to 0.545

Added the following modules: OLE-Storage_Lite 0.14, Spreadsheet-ParseExcel 0.2603, Spreadsheet-WriteExcel 2.14, XML-Simple 2.14, XML-SimpleObject 0.53, XML-SimpleObject-LibXML 0.60, XML-TreeBuilder 3.09
Fix usage bug on Redhat Linux. doesn't work with strings in read-only memory.

Added the following modules: Class-DBI-mysql 0.23, DBIx-ContextualFetch 1.02, Devel-Symdump 2.03, Devel-ptkdb 1.1091, GD-Graph3d 0.63, Module-Build 0.2609, Pod-Coverage 0.17, Pod-POM 0.15, String-Ediff 0.05, Test-Inline 0.16, Test-Manifest 1.14, Test-Pod-Coverage 1.06, Text-Autoformat 1.12, Text-Reform 1.11, Time-Piece 1.08, Time-Piece-MySQL 0.05, X11-GUITest 0.20, XML-RSS 1.05, XML-XPath 1.13, interface 0.02

package.name: gcc
package.description: The GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) provides a standard conforming and highly portable ISO C, ISO C++, Fortran 77, Java, and Ada compiler.

item.para: Incorporate patch for PR11459 (http://gcc.gnu.org/PR11459), -ansi -std=c99 -pedantic warns about C90's non long-long support when in C99 mode
Incorporate patch for PR19683 (http://gcc.gnu.org/PR19683), MIPS wrong-code for 64-bit multiply
Incorporate patch for PR20301 (http://gcc.gnu.org/PR20301), assembler labels have a leading "-"
Incorporate patch for PR21888 (http://gcc.gnu.org/PR21888), bootstrap failure with linker relaxation enabled
Incorporate patch for PR21889 (http://gcc.gnu.org/PR21889), native Solaris assembler cannot grok DTP-relative debug symbols

Incorporate gcc/fixinc/inclhack.def, gcc/fixinc/fixincl.x, and gcc/fixinc/tests/base/iso from 3.4 branch for PR19933 (http://gcc.gnu.org/PR19933), problem with define of HUGE_VAL in math_c99, and to workaround the definition of the PTHREAD_*_INITIALIZER macros on Tru64 UNIX 5.1
Incorporate patch for PR10692 (http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=10692), M68K miscompilation of perl with -O2 -fPIC
Merge patch from 3.4 branch for c-typeck.c (same_translation_unit_p) to fix a typo
Incorporate patch for PR17636 (http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=17636), "truncation failed in endfile" error when closing a file appended to in libf2c fortran library
Incorporate patch for PR22083 (http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22083), TARGET_C99_FUNCTIONS is wrongly defined on AIX 5.1
Include GNU prof (ggprof)
Add as.info documentation
Backport of patch for PR17242 (http://gcc.gnu.org/PR17242) for HP-UX

package.name: gdbm
package.description: GNU dbm is a set of database routines that use extendible hashing and works similar to the standard UNIX dbm routines.

item.para: Backport memory leak fix from 1.8.3

package.name: xpm
package.description:
XPM (X PixMap) is a format for storing/retrieving X pixmaps to/from files.
The XPM Image Library contains a set of four functions, similar to the X bitmap functions as defined in the Xlib: XpmCreatePixmapFromData, XpmCreateDataFromPixmap, XpmReadFileToPixmap and XpmWriteFileFromPixmap for respectively including, storing, reading and writing this format, plus four other: XpmCreateImageFromData, XpmCreateDataFromImage, XpmReadFileToImage and XpmWriteFileFromImage for working with images instead of pixmaps.

item.para: Apply patch for CAN-2004-0914 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0914), fixing integer overflows, out-of-bounds memory accesses, directory traversal, shell metacharacter, endless loops, and memory leaks, which could allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information, cause a denial of service (application crash), or execute arbitary code via a certain XPM image file.

Apply patch for CAN-2005-0605 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2005-0605), fixing a potentially exploitable buffer overflow in via a negative value. If an attacker tricked a user into loading a malicious XPM image with an application that uses libXpm, they could exploit this to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user opening the image.

Apply patch to fix CAN-2003-0687 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2003-0687), stack-based buffer overflows in the xpmParseColors(), ParseAndPutPixels(), and ParsePixels() functions allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a malformed XPM image file.

Apply patch to fix CAN-2004-0688 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2003-0688), integer overflows in the xpmParseColors(), XpmCreateImageFromXpmImage(), CreateXImage() ParsePixels(), and ParseAndPutPixels() functions allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a malformed XPM image file.

package.name: bbc
package.description: Client: Big Brother monitors System and Network-delivered services for availability. Your current network status is displayed on a color-coded web page in near-real time. When problems are detected, you're immediately notified by e-mail, pager, or text messaging.

package.name: hobbitc
package.description:
This is a server-side configuration hobbit client for ITIS Motorola Inc. Hobbit is a tool for monitoring servers, applications and networks. It collects information about the health of your computers, the applications running on them, and the network connectivity between them. All of this information is presented in a set of simple, intuitive webpages that are updated frequently to reflect changes in the status of your systems.
Hobbit is capable of monitoring a vast set of network services, e.g. mail-servers, web-servers (both plain HTTP and encrypted HTTPS), local server application logs, ressource utilisation and much more.
Much of the information is processed and stored in RRD files, which then form the basis for providing trend graphs showing how e.g. webserver response-times vary over time.
Hobbit started out as a replacement for a small part of Big Brother, and owes a great deal of inspiration to how Big Brother works. But Hobbit has grown to become a full scale monitoring solution, with features that match or exceed what Big Brother can do.

Using an XML configuration file to describe the package, the pkgutils suite automatically downloads and installs packages including all necessary dependencies, provides information on the list of installed packages, removes packages, configures packages (runs the package pre-remove and post-install scripts), and queries a repository for a list of updated packages.

package.name: pkgutils
package.description: Package-manager independent suite of tools used to install, remove, and configure binary packages. Using an XML configuration file to describe the package, the pkgutils suite automatically downloads and installs packages including all necessary dependencies, provides information on the list of installed packages, removes packages, configures packages (runs the package pre-remove and post-install scripts), and queries a repository for a list of updated packages.

package.name: powerbrokerclient
package.description: Client: Powerbroker

package.name: bash
package.description: Bash (Bourne-Again Shell) is an sh-compatible command language interpreter that executes commands read from the standard input or from a file. Bash also incorporates useful features from the Korn and C shells (ksh and csh). Bash is intended to be a conformant implementation of the IEEE POSIX Shell and Tools specification (IEEE Working Group 1003.2).

item.para: Disable getaddrinfo() on HP-UX because it is broken

package.name: ncurses
package.description: The ncurses (new curses) library is a freeware emulation of System V Release 4.0 curses. It uses terminfo format, supports pads and color and multiple highlights and forms characters and function-key mapping, and has all the other SYSV-curses enhancements over BSD curses. The distribution includes the library and support utilities, including a terminfo compiler tic, a decompiler infocmp, clear, tput, tset, and a termcap conversion tool captoinfo. Full manual pages are provided for the library and tools.

item.para: Include wide-character libraries
Upgrade to latest 20041225 patch release
Remove build directory from dependency_libs in *.la files

package.name: readline
package.description: The Readline library provides a set of functions for use by applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed in. Both Emacs and vi editing modes are available. The Readline library includes additional functions to maintain a list of previously-entered command lines, to recall and perhaps reedit those lines, and perform csh-like history expansion on previous commands.

item.para: Add Term-ReadLine-Gnu-1.15 Perl module which is added to default Perl include paths at postinstall

package.name: gettext
package.description: The GNU `gettext' utilities are a set of tools that provides a framework to help other GNU packages produce multi-lingual messages. These tools include a set of conventions about how programs should be written to support message catalogs, a directory and file naming organization for the message catalogs themselves, a runtime library supporting the retrieval of translated messages, and a few stand-alone programs to massage in various ways the sets of translatable strings, or already translated strings.

item.para: Remove libiconv dependency from libintl.pc as no include file requires it
Remove libiconv dependency from libintl.pc as no include file requires it

Update config.rpath and lib-link.m4 to add a new variable, hardcode_direct_absolute, to determine if linking the path of the shared library encodes the absolute path, unable to be overridden with the library search path environment variable (LIBPATH, LD_LIBRARY_PATH, or SHLIB_PATH).
Add 64-bit libraries
Upgrade expat dependency from 1.95.6 to 1.95.8
Add libintl.pc pkgconfig file

package.name: pcre
package.description: The PCRE library is a set of functions that implement regular expression pattern matching using the same syntax and semantics as Perl, with just a few differences. The current implementation of PCRE (release 4.x) corresponds approximately with Perl 5.8, including support for UTF-8 encoded strings. However, this support has to be explicitly enabled; it is not the default.

item.para: Apply patch for CAN-2005-2491 (http://www.cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2005-2491). Fix for an integer overflow with a subsequent buffer overflow triggered by a maliciously crafted regular expression allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

package.name: hobbit-client-local
package.description: Hobbit Monitor is a system for monitoring hosts and networks, inspired by the Big Brother system. It provides realtime monitoring, an easy-to-use Web interface, historical data, availability reports, and performance graphs. This package is for a hobbit monitoring client, and includes the client parts of a full system, requiring a hobbit server on the network to report to in order to be useful.

package.name: hobbit-client
package.description: Hobbit Monitor is a system for monitoring hosts and networks, inspired by the Big Brother system. It provides realtime monitoring, an easy-to-use Web interface, historical data, availability reports, and performance graphs. This package is for a hobbit monitoring client, and includes the client parts of a full system, requiring a hobbit server on the network to report to in order to be useful.

package.name: expat
package.description: Expat is an XML parser library written in C. It is a stream-oriented parser in which an application registers handlers for things the parser might find in the XML document (like start tags).

package.name: libiconv
package.description: libiconv provides an iconv() implementation, for use on systems which don't have one, or whose implementation cannot convert from/to Unicode.

item.para: Add support for Solaris "646" encoding by aliasing it to the "ASCII" encoding
Don't install shared library 644. Use the default libtool --mode=install permission, 755.
Add 64-bit library for HP-UX 11.x
Add runtime path to libcharset.pc
Add libiconv.pc pkgconfig file

package.name: hobbit-client
package.description: Hobbit Monitor is a system for monitoring hosts and networks, inspired by the Big Brother system. It provides realtime monitoring, an easy-to-use Web interface, historical data, availability reports, and performance graphs. This package is for a hobbit monitoring client, and includes the client parts of a full system, requiring a hobbit server on the network to report to in order to be useful.
